For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other)

Aluminum? Early 1900 — I have never used it.

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

More more elaborate containers now & less on them & food value. Cannot give date but change too gradual.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer. If this means in childhood. 1880 can remember we had our own pork, always fried for breakfast also oatmeal porridge; sometimes molasses & or applesauce or apple pie. Baked powder biscuits and homemade bread. Dinner potatoes various vegetables meat fresh or salt pork raised once a week with beef when butcher called. Liver or beef pudding or apple pie. Supper bread cold meat, rice or bread pudding or apple pie. With about 3 apples on the dresser, or apple pie. With about 3 apples on the table all evening for those who were still hungry.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada? ...1874........ Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Chicken, cranberries (wild), potatoes, vegetables, pudding with sauce. Candy, nuts, apples.

only circular print 2 & us.

20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

Of course, it was much warmer work preparing meals over a hot cookstove than the present day electric stoves. Sometimes took much longer to get a meal ready if the wind in the wrong direction and the stove wood on the green side, and slow to burn. Today's pressure cooking takes a lot less time and preserves more of the flavor food value.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homestead and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

Early in 1910 - when we started store keeping

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Eastern Canada. Include items not mentioned above; quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].

2. I'm glad we were able to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of purchasing fresh foods (GL). We had too many details and duties as parents.
